SEARCH
Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mailbox.maildir

Class MaildirFilename

java.lang.Object
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mailbox.maildir.MaildirFilename
public class MaildirFilename extends Object
Handles Maildir filename parsing and generation.

Maildir filenames encode message metadata including delivery time, uniqueness identifiers, size, and flags. The format is: 

 <timestamp>.<unique>,S=<size>:2,<flags>

Example: 1733356800000.12345.1,S=4523:2,SF

  • 1733356800000 - delivery timestamp in milliseconds
  • 12345.1 - process ID and counter for uniqueness
  • S=4523 - message size in bytes
  • :2, - info separator (always ":2," for standard Maildir)
  • SF - flags (Seen, Flagged)

Standard flags encoded as single uppercase letters:

  • D - Draft (\Draft)
  • F - Flagged (\Flagged)
  • R - Replied (\Answered)
  • S - Seen (\Seen)
  • T - Trashed (\Deleted)

Keywords (custom flags) are encoded as lowercase letters a-z, with the mapping stored in a separate keywords file.

Author:
Chris Burdess

      public MaildirFilename(long timestamp, String uniquePart, long size, Set<Flag> flags, Set<Integer> keywordIndices)
      Creates a new Maildir filename with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      timestamp - the delivery timestamp
      uniquePart - the unique identifier part
      size - the message size in bytes
      flags - the message flags
      keywordIndices - indices of keywords (for lowercase letters)

      flags - the initial flags
      keywordIndices - the keyword indices
